source_sentence: 佛說佛大僧大經
translation: Foshuo fosheng dajie jing

source_sentence: 宋居士沮渠京聲譯
translation: Song Jushi Juqu Jingsheng Translation

source_sentence: 佛在王舍國。
translation: The Buddha was in the kingdom of Śākyamuni.

source_sentence: 國有富者，其名曰厲，金銀眾寶、田地舍宅、牛馬奴婢，不可稱數。
translation: There was a wealthy man in that country named Rājagṛha who had an incalculable amount of gold, silver, and other treasures, land, homes, cattle, horses, and servants.

source_sentence: 厲年西耄，絕無繼嗣。
translation: He was old and senile and had no heirs.

source_sentence: 其國常法，人無子者，死後財物，皆沒入官。
translation: It was the state's usual rule that if a person had no children, their property would be confiscated and put into the government after their death.

source_sentence: 厲禱日月諸天鬼神，并九子母山樹諸神，皆從請子，不能致之。
translation: He prayed to the gods and spirits of the sun and moon, and to the gods of the nine sons and mothers of mountains and trees, all of whom asked for a son, but they couldn't get him.

source_sentence: 厲自念曰：「人有緩急，輒往自歸山樹之神，靡所不至，財寶消索，產業不修，疾病相仍，災禍首尾，奴婢死亡，六畜不孳，俱為妖孽。
translation: He said to himself, "When people are in a hurry, they often go to the gods of the mountains and trees and nothing is left unattended, and their wealth and treasure disappear, their property isn't repaired, illness continues, disasters begin and end, slaves and children die, and their six animals don't reproduce; they're all evil.

source_sentence: 鬼神導師，迷惑舞使，亂君內居，云當有福，而禍重至，由盲吞毒謂之良藥，庶有瘳損，毒著喪身。
translation: Ghosts and spirits guide them, confuse them, dance with them, and disrupt their inner lives, saying that there will be fortune, but woe comes when they blindly swallow poison, which is called good medicine, so that they may be healed but the poison will bind them.

source_sentence: 吾今殺生祠祀鬼神，當入地獄，而望天祚，豈不惑哉！
translation: Now, if I kill people and sacrifice to ghosts and spirits, I'll go to hell and hope for the prosperity of heaven, isn't that confusing?

source_sentence: 世有佛道，高操之聖，有得仙者，名曰應真人。
translation: In the world, there's the Buddha Way, a noble one of high discipline, and there's an attainment of immortality called the response of true people.

source_sentence: 真人清淨，如瑠璃珠，精進存想，乃覩之耳，奉斯道者，唯守靖漠，無欲無求，以斯為樂，現世得安，終生天上。」
translation: A true person is pure like a lapis lazuli pearl, and it's only when you diligently cultivate perception that you'll see them. Those who follow this path simply observe peaceful indifference, have no desires and no wants, and take pleasure in this, and they'll attain peace in the present life and be born up in the heavens at the end of it."

source_sentence: 厲自念曰：「置吾常供養，奉佛三寶。」
translation: She then said to herself, "I'll always make offerings to the Buddha's three treasures."

source_sentence: 奉佛一載，婦遇生男，厲曰：「奉佛獲願，字曰佛大，佛諸弟子，謚比丘僧。」
translation: After serving the Buddha for a year, the woman met a man who was born, and he said, "Because of the Buddha's vow, I'm called Buddha Da, a disciple of the Buddha, and a monk of the company of bhikṣus."

source_sentence: 試復事之，事未滿歲，復生賢男，字曰僧大。
translation: She tried to serve him again, but before the service was over, she gave birth to another good son named Saṃdha.

source_sentence: 厲訓二子，示以聖道。
translation: He gave a stern lecture to his two sons and showed them the noble way.

source_sentence: 僧大稟性，仁愛人物，孝心難攀，誦佛法戒，親近沙門，清淨知足，親覩其志，愛之有特。
translation: He recited the Buddha's teachings and precepts, became intimate with the ascetics, was pure and contented, and was well liked by his relatives who saw his aspirations.

source_sentence: 親被疾著床，即呼長子，涕泣誡之：「夫生有死，萬物無常，持戒者安，犯戒者危，其持佛戒，終始無患。
translation: When his father fell ill and got into bed, he called his eldest son and admonished him with tears, "Birth has death, and all things are impermanent; those who observe the precepts are safe; those who violate them are in danger; their observance of the Buddha's precepts will never cause them any trouble.

source_sentence: 僧大尚小，仁孝清白……」厲已累爾，辭句適竟，奄忽歿故。
translation: Monks, it's better to be noble than small; be kind, filial, and pure..." After he had finished speaking, he suddenly died.

source_sentence: 弟去所天，孤無歸告，數啟其兄：「欲作沙門。」
translation: When his younger brother left for that god, the orphan had no one to turn to, so he repeatedly asked his brother, "I want to become an ascetic."

source_sentence: 其國之法，兒欲求婦，便佯詐云：「欲作沙門。」
translation: According to the rules of his country, when his son wanted to marry, he pretended, saying, "I want to be an ascetic."

source_sentence: 親懼其然，立為娉妻。
translation: Fearing this, his relatives decide to make him a wife.

source_sentence: 佛大以弟等彼偽類，即為尋索國最賢家女，字快見，光華煒煒，端正少雙，長短肥瘦，適得其中，貞潔慈孝，猶星中月，國女賢婦，靡不歎悅。
translation: The Buddha then asked his disciples to find the most virtuous woman in his country, a woman whose name was Quickly Seeing, whose radiance was brilliant, whose appearance was correct and few in number, whose length was short and fat, and whose suitability was such that she was chaste, loving, and filial, like the moon among the stars, and whose popularity among the country's women was not uncommon.

source_sentence: 婦歸昇堂，兄會賓客，九族欣然無不和樂，兄於眾賓，調其弟曰：「當今之日，可作沙門乎？」
translation: When the woman returned and ascended to the hall, the brother met his guests, and the nine families were delighted and happy.

source_sentence: 僧大答曰：「大兄！
translation: The saṃgha replied, "Eldest brother!

source_sentence: 放吾使作沙門，實我宿願。」
translation: Releasing me to become a monk is really my long-cherished wish."

source_sentence: 寤兄者天審欲作之，戲之曰：「可從爾志願。」
translation: He woke up with a brother who wanted to do it in divine judgment and teased him, saying, "We can grant you your wish."

source_sentence: 弟心歡喜，為兄作禮，即日入山。
translation: Rejoicing in his heart, he paid homage to his brother and went into the mountains the same day.

source_sentence: 見一沙門，年少端正，獨處樹下，前趣叉手，稽首為禮，却住問曰：「賢者何緣，行作沙門？」
translation: He saw an ascetic, young and correct, standing alone under a tree, approaching him with his palms together, bowing his head in homage, and stopped to ask, "Good man, what is the reason you're practicing to become an ascetic?"

source_sentence: 其人已得應真之道，豫知去來無數劫事，謂僧大曰：「佛經說言：『人好婬泆，如火燒身，如持炬火逆風而行，其焰稍却，不置炬者，火燒其手，猶烏銜肉，鷹鸇追爭，烏不置肉，災及軀命。』
translation: That man, having attained the path that should be true, and knowing with certainty the events of countless eons in the past and future, said to the great monk, "The Buddhist sūtras say, 'A person who is intoxicated by sexual indulgence is like a fire burning his body; it's like holding a torch and walking against the wind while its flame is slightly deflated; if you don't put the torch away, the fire will burn your hand, like a crow holding flesh and an eagle chasing after it; if the crow doesn't put the flesh away, the disaster will affect your body and life.'

source_sentence: 婬泆如斯，無不危殆，吾以是故，作沙門耳。
translation: Such licentiousness is not without peril, and it's for this reason that I became a monk.

source_sentence: 蜜塗利刀，小兒貪甜，以舌舐之，有截舌之患。
translation: Honey coats a sharp knife, and a child who laps it up with his tongue will run the risk of having his tongue cut off.

source_sentence: 「婬泆之人，苟快愚心，不惟其後，有燒身之害。
translation: "A licentious person who takes delight in foolish thoughts won't only be harmed later, but also have their body burned.

source_sentence: 譬如餓狗得路枯骨，齮[齒*齊]齩齧，傷口缺齒，適自傷毀，何益於己？
translation: It's like a hungry dog that gets a dead bone in the road and sears it with its [teeth*aligned], injuring its mouth and missing teeth, and it's fit to injure itself, so what good will it do to itself?

source_sentence: 婬泆如此，百千億劫，無絲髮之福，而有三塗之罪，吾念是故，作沙門耳。
translation: Such licentiousness will last for a hundred billion eons, without the merit of a single hair, but with the guilt of the three destinies, and I'm mindful that this is why I became a monk.

source_sentence: 「譬如樹木華果茂盛，行人貪之，杖石撾擿，須臾之間，華損果落，枝葉殘傷。
translation: "It's like a tree that's luxuriant in flowers and fruit, and a person covets it and lays a stick or stone against it; in a moment, the flowers and fruit fall off and the branches and leaves are torn.

source_sentence: 樹以華果，自招凋喪。
translation: The tree's flowers and fruit wither on their own.

source_sentence: 蛾貪火色，投入于燈，體見燒煮，將何剋獲？
translation: A moth that covets the color of fire and throws itself into a lamp sees its body burned, so what will it get?

source_sentence: 為婬惑者不別善惡，遠賢親愚，日就流冥，亡國滅眾，死入地獄，惡著罪成？
translation: For those who are deluded by sexual desire and don't discriminate between good and evil, they distance themselves from the good and draw near to the foolish, going into daily seclusion, losing their country and their people, dying and going to hell, and what are the consequences of bad attachments?

source_sentence: 悔將何逮。
translation: How would I ever regret it?

source_sentence: 佛見之諦開示聖道，吾望佛恩，得覩經戒，心守清白，獨而無患，顧視流俗，乃知誤耳。
translation: Seeing the Buddha's truth and disclosing the noble path, I hoped for the Buddha's blessing, got to see the sūtras and precepts, kept my mind pure, and was left alone without worry, but looking at the common people, I realized that I had been mistaken.

source_sentence: 吾以是故，作沙門也。」
translation: It's for this reason that I've become an ascetic."

source_sentence: 僧大聞之，頓首足下長跪而白：「佛真上聖，諸天之尊，經以滅癡，入我心中。
translation: When the monk heard this, he bowed his head at his feet and knelt down long enough to say, "The Buddha is truly a great sage, the most honored of the gods, and the sūtras have entered my mind by quelling delusion.

source_sentence: 願去世濁，履清淨道，奉沙門戒，以為榮福。」
translation: May I pass away defiled, fulfill the pure path, and uphold ascetic precepts for the honor and benefit of others."

source_sentence: 師即喻之沙門重戒。
translation: The teacher then described it as an ascetic who respected the precepts.

source_sentence: 侍師數月，即啟師云：「何意？
translation: After serving the master for several months, he asked him, "What do you mean?

source_sentence: 欲入山間，寂定禪息，求道應真，爾乃滅患。」
translation: They want to enter the mountains, calm their minds and meditate, and seek the way and the truth, and then they'll be able to end their troubles."

source_sentence: 師曰：「獨居山中，大難處也。
translation: The teacher said, "Living alone in the mountains is a difficult place.

source_sentence: 處山澤者，當學星宿明知候時，常當儲偫水火麨蜜。
translation: Those who live in the mountains and swamps should train the stars to know exactly when to expect them, and they should always store water, fire, and honey.

source_sentence: 所以然者，盜賊之求水火麨蜜，夜半向晨，問當解之，給賊所欲，違其意者，賊輒殺人。」
translation: That's why, when a thief asks for water, fire, bread, and honey at midnight or toward dawn, he'll understand and give it to the thief as he desires; if he disagrees with him, the thief will easily kill him."

source_sentence: 僧大曰：「諾！
translation: The saṃgha said, "Yes!

source_sentence: 敬奉慈教，具學所命。」
translation: I respectfully submit to your compassionate teaching, and I have fully studied the commands."

source_sentence: 却乃入山。
translation: But then he went into the mountains.

source_sentence: 其兄念曰：「弟作沙門，終不畜妻。」
translation: His brother remembered, "I've been an ascetic, but I'll never keep my wife."

source_sentence: 妻快見者，端正無雙，兄心悅之，起從快見，持琴自隨，作姿彈之，歌婬泆之曲：「煌煌欝金，生于野田，過時不採，宛見棄捐，曼爾豐熾，華色惟新，與我同歡，固斯厚親，年一西宿，孰復爾珍？」
translation: His wife, Quickly Seeing, was so elegant and unmatched that his brother was pleased with her, so he got up and followed Quickly Seeing, took his lute and played it in a poetic manner, singing a licentious song, "Brilliant gold, born in a wild field, left unpicked after a long time, seemingly discarded, abundantly flushed, with new flowers, with whom I'm enjoying myself, is certainly a good relative, and who else would treasure it if I were to stay in the west for a year?"

source_sentence: 快見即覺兄欲為亂，便以歌曲，答佛大曰：「巍巍我師，天人之尊，門徒清潔，謚曰沙門，歎真為聖，婬為畜倫，我受嚴戒，不事二君，終不婬生，寧就寸分。」
translation: Quickly seeing him, he realized that his brother wanted to cause trouble, so he replied to the Buddha in song, "My teacher is so lofty, so venerable among gods and men, so clean are his disciples, so he's called an ascetic, so he praises the truth as noble, and lust is an animal.

source_sentence: 佛大作情悲之曲、委靡之辭：「宿心加爾，故因良媒，問名詣師，占相良時，慘慘惕惕，懼爾不來，既覩光顏，我心怡怡，今不合歡，豈徒費哉，斯誓為定，淑女何疑。」
translation: The Buddha then composed a great song of sympathy and commiserating words, "My former intention was to help you, so I asked a good match, asked for a name, visited a master, took a good photograph, was worried and fearful that you wouldn't come, and now that I've seen your radiant face, my heart is happy, and I don't like it now.

source_sentence: 快見惶[怡-台+勺]，歌答之曰：「佛設禮儀，尊卑有敘，叔妻即子，婿伯即父，我親奉戒，日有隆舉，真與聖齊，婬正蟲鼠。
translation: Quickly seeing his fear [yi-tai+spoon], he replied in song, "The Buddha established rituals, a hierarchy of honor and inferiority, an uncle's wife as son, a son-in-law as father, my intimate observance of precepts, and daily successes, which are truly equal to that of the sages, and lust is proper to worms and rats.

source_sentence: 噫乎伯子！
translation: Oh, my lord!

source_sentence: 焉為斯語。」
translation: How could I say this?"

source_sentence: 兄心迷惑，貪好快見，其意又甚，不可轉移。
translation: A brother's mind is deluded, and his desire for quick views is so great that his intentions can't be transferred.

source_sentence: 快見又歌：「夫人處世，當遠二事，不孝婬亂，行違佛戒，天及賢者，箋其自異。」
translation: Quickly, he also sings, "A woman's world should be free of two things: unfiliality, debauchery, and conduct that violates the Buddha's precepts, so gods and good men will ask for their own differences."

source_sentence: 佛大歌曰：「爾之容色，懌懌灼然，普天美女，豈有爾顏，我心相悅，故踰大山。」
translation: The Buddha then sang, "Your features are beautiful, and it's a pleasant sight to see, how could there be a more beautiful woman in the whole world than you? My heart's delight is so great that it surpasses a great mountain."

source_sentence: 快見自念：「斯子欲我，悖狂之亂，沮致大難，請說身中惡露不淨，爾乃却耳。」
translation: Kakuza thought to himself, "This son wants me to be so disobedient and confused that it would cause great trouble.

source_sentence: 快見重曰：「仁貪我軀，軀有何好？
translation: Kakuza then repeated, "You like my body, but what's so great about it?

source_sentence: 頭有九骨，合為髑髏，中但有腦，面有七孔，皆出洟唾；以皮裹骨，貪頭頸者，皮肉相裹，身有毛髮爪齒皮肌血腦骨肉；腹中有心脾腎腸胃肪肺屎尿膿血寒熱，足與脛連，脛與髀連，髀與尻連，尻與腰連，腰與脊連，脊與脇連，脇與頸連，頸與髑髏連，臂與肘連，肘與肩連。
translation: There are nine bones in the head, which are united into a skull, a brain in the middle, seven orifices in the face, all of which release mucus and saliva; bones covered with skin, and those who covet the head and neck will be covered with skin and flesh; the body has hair, nails, teeth, skin, muscles, blood, brains, bones, and flesh; in the belly there's the heart, spleen, kidneys, intestines, stomach, fat, lungs, feces, urine, pus, blood, cold, and heat; the feet are connected to the shins, the shins to the thighs, the thighs to the coccyx, the coccyx to the waist, the waist to the spine, the spine to the hypochondrium, the hypochondrium to the neck, the neck to Calvary, the arms to the elbows, and the elbows to the shoulders.

source_sentence: 我如畫瓶，中盈屎尿，身中不淨，可惡如此，何可貪乎！
translation: I'm like a painted vase filled with feces and urine, and my body is impure and abominable, so why should I desire it?

source_sentence: 凡人所喜，有說其惡，心即賤之。」
translation: Ordinary people like what's said about them, but if someone says something bad, their mind will despise them."

source_sentence: 佛大自念：「女念其婿，何肯聽我？
translation: The Buddha greatly reflects to himself, "Why would a woman who misses her son-in-law be willing to listen to me?

source_sentence: 我殺弟者，爾乃隨耳。」
translation: I killed my disciple, so you just followed me."

source_sentence: 佛大瞋恚，即行募求數為賊者，見輕薄人，在于酒家，前與語曰：「寧知我家所畜六藉奴子，逃作沙門，今在山中。」
translation: The Buddha was furious, so he went out and recruited a number of thieves. He saw a despicable man in a restaurant and told him, "Do you know that my family had six slave children who escaped to become ascetics and are now in the mountains?"

source_sentence: 賊曰：「識之。」
translation: The thief said, "I know them."

source_sentence: 佛大即出金銀與之，令殺奴子：「疾取其頭及身上衣，所持法杖，足下履屣，皆以相還，吾復重賜卿等金銀。」
translation: The Buddha then gave him gold and silver and told him to kill his slave, "Quickly take his head, the clothes he's wearing, the staff he's holding, and the shoes he's wearing under his feet and return them to me, and I'll give you gold and silver again."

source_sentence: 賊大喜曰：「從吾取足。」
translation: The thief was delighted, saying, "Take their feet from me."

source_sentence: 即去入山。
translation: He then left and went into the mountains.

source_sentence: 到其弟所呼曰：「沙門！
translation: He went to his brother's place and called out, "Ascetic!

source_sentence: 汝疾出來。」
translation: Come out quickly," he said.

source_sentence: 其弟出曰：「諸君何求？
translation: His disciple came out and said, "What do you gentlemen want?

source_sentence: 吾有水火麨蜜可食。」
translation: I have some water, fire, sand, and honey to eat."

source_sentence: 夜時已半，賊曰：「不求水火麨蜜，不問卿時也，欲得汝頭持去之耳。」
translation: Halfway through the night, the thief said, "I'm not asking for water, fire, oil, or honey; I don't want to ask you about the time, but I want to get your head and carry it away."

source_sentence: 其弟聞之，即大惶怖，涕泣而曰：「吾非長者諸侯子也，捨俗為道，與世無爭，學道日淺，未獲溝港、頻來、不還、應真六通，殺吾何益？」
translation: When his disciple heard this, he became terrified and said through tears and sobs, "I'm not the son of a venerable lord; I left the secular world for the path; I have no quarrel with the world; my training in the path has become shallow; and I haven't yet acquired the six powers of guttering, frequently coming, not returning, and response to the truth; what good would it do to kill me?"

source_sentence: 賊曰：「來為汝首故，空復云云，求哀何益？」
translation: The thief said, "What good is it to seek pity for you when you come here because you're the head and it's empty and cloudy?"

source_sentence: 其弟自念：「此賊獨聞我富家，謂我持寶來在此也。」
translation: His brother thought to himself, "This thief alone heard about my wealthy family, saying that I had come here with my treasure."

source_sentence: 語其賊曰：「欲得寶者，吾兄在家，字曰佛大，吾與書令惠卿寶，在所欲得，從卿志願。」
translation: He told the thief, "My brother is at home and his name is Buddha, so I'll tell him and his secretary to give you the treasure that you want to have, if you want it."

source_sentence: 賊曰：「子兄令我來殺子。」
translation: The thief said, "My brother told me to come and kill him."

source_sentence: 其弟曰：「即吾今死矣，由斯婦也。
translation: His brother said, "Even now, I'm dead because of this woman.

source_sentence: 師前誡我，人與婬居，如持炬火逆風而行，捨之不早，火將燒手。
translation: My teacher warned me earlier, 'Living with a woman in a lustful relationship is like holding a torch and walking against the wind; if you don't abandon it sooner, the fire will burn your hand.

source_sentence: 如蜜塗刀，如鷹追烏，狗得枯骨，樹之華菓，色為身害，深如師誡。」
translation: It's like honey coating a sword, like an eagle chasing a crow, a dog getting a withered bone, or a tree with flowers and fruits, and form is harmful to the body, just as the teacher warned."

source_sentence: 涕泣從賊：「乞一歲活，令吾得道。
translation: Weeping, he complied with the thief, "Please let me live a year, so I can achieve the Way.

source_sentence: 吾常在此，相殺不晚。」
translation: I'll always be here, so it won't be too late to kill each other."

source_sentence: 賊曰：「今欲得子頭去，何云一歲？
translation: The thief said, "Now, I want to get rid of my son's head, so why is it one year?

source_sentence: 山居道人，多得道者，恐子輕舉行神足去，勿復多云，俘取頭去。」
translation: Many religious practitioners living in the mountains have attained the Way; they're afraid their children will take their spiritual feet lightly and leave; don't say much; take their heads away."

source_sentence: 其弟重曰：「願莫即殺，先斷我一髀置吾前也。」
translation: The disciple said repeatedly, "Please don't kill me right away; first, cut off one of my thighs and put it in front of me."

source_sentence: 其賊因前，先斷一髀，置於其前，弟遭此痛，痛不可言，天來下至道人所曰：「慎莫恐怖，牢持汝心；汝前世時，入畜生中，人所屠割，稱賣汝肉，非一世矣，地獄餓鬼，汝皆更之，苦痛以來，非適今也。」
translation: The thief caused him to first cut off one of his thighs and put it in front of him. When this pain struck him, the gods came down to the practitioner and said, "Don't be afraid; keep your mind firmly in check; in a previous life, you were slaughtered by humans and sold for your flesh, not just in one life, and you've been subjected to the same pain in hell and the hungry ghosts.

source_sentence: 僧大語天：「一哀語我師令知，吾因師示吾道，死生何在？」
translation: The saṃgha spoke loudly to the gods, "I was told by a compassionate teacher to let him know that I had been shown the way by my teacher, "Where's death and birth?"

source_sentence: 天即為行語其師曰：「卿賢弟子，人欲殺之，涕泣求哀，欲得見師。」
translation: The gods then took action and told their teacher, "You're a good disciple whom people want to kill, and you're weeping and begging for mercy to see your teacher."

source_sentence: 師飛行到弟子所，為說經曰：「天地須彌，尚有滅壞，海有消竭，七日有壞。
translation: The teacher flew to the disciple and taught him the sūtras, saying, "Sumeru of heaven and earth still ceases and decays, and the ocean is depleted for seven days.

source_sentence: 天下有風，其名惟嵐，惟嵐一起，山山相搏，斯風有滅，況汝小軀，何等比數，但當念佛。
translation: There's a wind under the heavens that's called nothing but wind, and when it comes together, mountains and hills fight each other, and this wind has an extinction, so why don't you, little body, what's the comparison, just be mindful of the Buddha?

source_sentence: 佛常言無常，盛必有衰，合會有離，榮位難保，身亦如之。」
translation: The Buddha always says that it's impermanent; there's bound to be decline when there's prosperity, separation when there's union, and difficulty in preserving your position of honor; so it is with your body."

source_sentence: 僧大便得溝港道，復斷一髀，重念師戒，復得頻來道；賊斷左手，復念師戒，得不還道；賊斷右手，復念師戒，得應真道；便不畏三惡道也，生死自在，無所復畏。
translation: The great monk then attained the path of the gutter port, cut off another thigh, reverted to mindfulness of the teacher's precepts, and again attained the path of the frequently come; the thief cut off his left hand, reverted to mindfulness of the teacher's precepts, and attained the path of no-return; the thief cut off his right hand, reverted to mindfulness of the teacher's precepts, and attained the path of response to truth; he then wasn't afraid of the three evil destinies and had no further fear of birth-and-death.

source_sentence: 僧大曰：「取樹皮來。」
translation: The monk asked him, "Get the bark of a tree."

source_sentence: 即為剝樹皮與之。
translation: He then peeled off the bark of the tree for him and gave it to him.

source_sentence: 僧大取枝以為筆，自刺身血，書樹皮曰：「大兄起居隨時安善，二親在時，以吾累兄。
translation: The great monk took a branch, used it as a brush, pricked himself with blood, and wrote on the bark, "Eldest brother, get up and live in comfort at all times; when my two relatives were here, I was a burden to my brother.

source_sentence: 兄不承之，違廢親教，以女色故，骨肉相殘，違親慈教為不孝也。
translation: When my older brother didn't honor him, he disobeyed his relatives' teaching, and because of the sexuality of women, his flesh and blood were mutilated.

source_sentence: 殘殺人命為不仁也，殺一畜生其罪不小，況殺應真。
translation: Killing a human life is unkind, and killing an animal is no small crime, let alone killing someone who deserves to be killed.

source_sentence: 吾不中止，兄自招之，念吾有形，可得相殺，善逝寂寞，徒復相害。
translation: I won't stop, but I'll invite my brother to remember that I have form and could kill each other, and that I'm lonely and well gone, so I'll only harm each other.

source_sentence: 長別努力，願崇真道。」
translation: I'll make a long separation and vow to honor the true path."

source_sentence: 曳頸長二尺，語其賊曰：「子斷吾頭，由泥頭也，勿有恐意，吾恐汝等墮地獄中。」
translation: Dragging his neck two feet, he told the thief, "My son cut off my head because it's a clay head; don't be afraid, for I'm afraid you'll fall into hell."

source_sentence: 賊前斷頭，取身上衣被杖屣及鉢，持至兄所，衣杖屣鉢，皆持與兄，兄以金銀重謝其賊。
translation: The thief then cut off his head, took his robe, staff, sandals, and bowl, took them to his brother, and gave him his robe, staff, sandals, and bowl.

source_sentence: 兄取弟頭，為作假形，以頭著上，以衣衣之，杖鉢及屣，皆著其傍，謂快見曰：「汝婿來歸，可問訊之。」
translation: He took his brother's head, made it look like a fake, put his head on top, put his robe on top, put his staff, bowl, and sandals on his side, and told Quickly See, "Your son-in-law has come home, so you can ask about him."

source_sentence: 快見大喜，走至其所，見閉目坐，以為思道，妻不敢呼，具作美食，須念道：「覺當飯之。」
translation: Quickly perceiving his great joy, he went to his place and saw him sitting with his eyes closed, thinking about the way. His wife didn't dare to call him, but he prepared a delicious meal and had to think, "I think I'll be able to eat."

source_sentence: 日中不覺，妻因前曰：「日今已中，恐過時也。」
translation: When he didn't realize it by midday, his wife said, "It's the middle of the day; I'm afraid it's too late."

source_sentence: 怪其不應，牽衣起之，頭便墮地，身皆分散，各在一面，妻即大怖，擗踊呼曰：「子竟坐，吾見殘賊乎。」
translation: She was terrified, and she called out from the floor, "How could you sit here? I've seen the remaining thieves!"

source_sentence: 哀憤呼天，摧裂肝心，崩血出口，奄忽而死。
translation: She cried out to heaven in anger and rage, tore her liver and heart, bled out, and died suddenly.

source_sentence: 戒行清白，難污如空，樹心聖範，難動如地，貞淨行高，難揆如天。
translation: Their moral conduct is pure and difficult to defile like space, their noble examples of tree mind are difficult to move like the ground, and their chaste conduct is high and difficult to consider like the heavens.

source_sentence: 其未終時，諸天咨嗟，豫安所生，迎其魂靈，處忉利天，忍須臾之婬，獲天上難盡之榮。
translation: Before his death, the gods sigh with admiration, wishing him well, welcome his soul to the Heaven of Thirty-three, tolerate a moment's lust, and obtain an inexhaustible amount of glory in heaven.

source_sentence: 兄入神室視婦胡為，兄見弟頭身分散狼藉，其婦吐血死在一面，兄見弟妻尸死如此，呼曰：「咄咄！
translation: When a brother enters the gods' abode to examine his wife's behavior, he sees his brother's head and body scattered in a disorderly fashion, and his wife spitting blood and dying on one side.

source_sentence: 吾為逆天，所作酷裂，乃致於此。」
translation: I did something cruel and contrary to heaven, and it's brought us here."

source_sentence: 兄即至賊所問其意：「吾弟臨沒，將有遺言乎？」
translation: My brother then went to the thief's house and asked him what he thought, "Will my brother have any last words when he dies?"

source_sentence: 賊曰：「有書。」
translation: The thief said, "There's a book."

source_sentence: 以書見之。
translation: He presented it to him in writing.

source_sentence: 書辭懇惻，讀書訖竟，五內噎塞，涕泣交撗：「吾違尊親臨亡慈教，骨肉相殘，又殺應真，感激而死，死入地獄。」
translation: When he finished reading the document, he was overcome by tears and sobs, saying, "I disobeyed your father's teaching on compassion, killing Yingzhen and my flesh and blood, and I died of gratitude and went to hell."

source_sentence: 王及臣民，聞其事變，麾涕泣哽噎，歎述清德，殯葬其弟，四輩立塔，天龍鬼神，側塞空中，散華燒香，無不傷心。
translation: When the king and his subjects heard about what had happened, they all sobbed and choked up, praised his virtue, buried his brother, erected four stūpas, and scattered flowers and burned incense in the air as gods and dragons surrounded him.

source_sentence: 其妻快見，國人葬之，舉哀動國，諸天下讚，精進得道，五戒不虧，貞生天上。
translation: His wife was pleased to see him buried, and the nation was moved to mourn him, and the world praised him for his diligence in attaining the Way, his five precepts, and his chaste birth in heaven.

source_sentence: 違佛法教，不孝殘聖，死入地獄，燒煮苦毒，其歲難數。
translation: He disobeyed the Buddha's teaching, was unfilial and cruel to sages, and was sent to hell where he died, burned, and suffered pain for years that are hard to count.

source_sentence: 佛便告諸弟子，自斯之後，重相勅勵，尚於無欲。
translation: The Buddha then told his disciples that from this point forward, they should repeatedly encourage each other to remain desireless.

source_sentence: 佛說經竟，諸弟子歡喜，作禮而去。
translation: When the Buddha finished speaking the sūtra, the disciples rejoiced, paid homage, and departed.

source_sentence: 佛說佛大僧大經
translation: The Buddha taught the Buddha's great saṃgha great sūtra.
